subject: fix(interest-form): resolve mobile Chrome CORS/SW fetch failures
body:
Three changes to fix "Failed to fetch" TypeErrors on mobile Chrome:

1. Add explicit NetworkOnly runtimeCaching strategy for Vercel API
   endpoints in the service worker config. The navigateFallbackDenylist
   only controls navigation fallback â€” it does not prevent the SW fetch
   handler from intercepting cross-origin requests, which can break
   CORS preflight on some mobile Chrome versions.

2. Add CORS-aware error detection in InterestForm: after all fetch
   attempts fail with TypeError, a mode:'no-cors' probe differentiates
   "server unreachable" from "CORS misconfigured", giving users a more
   actionable error message instead of the generic network error.

3. Split DebugBanner "API Reachable" diagnostic into two checks:
   a no-cors reachability probe and a cors OPTIONS request. This
   separates network failures from CORS misconfigurations in the
   diagnostics panel, making future debugging clearer.

Tags: pwa, cors, mobile, service-worker, debug
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: medium
Debt: paid
Epic: interest-form
Semver: patch

title: resolve mobile Chrome CORS/SW fetch failures
